column1: 'bony contusion'~'bruise on the bone'~'acute fracture'~'recent break or crack in the bone'~'Medial and lateral joint compartment'~'inner and outer sections of the joint'~'retropatellar joint space'~'the area behind the kneecap'~'articular cartilage'~'smooth, white tissue that covers the ends of bones where they come together to form joints'~'degenerative cyst'~'a fluid-filled sac that forms due to wear and tear'~'quadriceps tendon'~'large tendon (connective tissue linking muscle to bone) that connects the muscles on the front of the thigh to the knee'~'intrameniscal signal'~'signal inside the meniscus, a rubbery disk that cushions the knee, often related to damage or tear'~'anterior and posterior cruciate ligaments'~'ligaments located inside the knee joint that cross each other to form an "X"'~'lateral and medial collateral ligaments'~'ligaments on the sides of the knee providing stability'~'suprapatellar bursa'~'a small fluid-filled sac located above the kneecap that reduces friction'~'prepatellar bursa'~'a small fluid-filled sac in front of the kneecap that reduces friction'~'Grade 4 chondromalacia patella'~'severe softening or wearing away of the cartilage under the kneecap'~'subchondral cyst formation'~'formation of a fluid-filled sac beneath the cartilage'~'arthroscopic debridement'~'a minimally invasive surgery to remove damaged tissue'~'intra-articular fluid'~'fluid inside the joint'~'physiologic'~'normal or healthy'
